org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core

Class AsyncProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.Provider<T,S>
      • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AndroidProvider<T,S>
        • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AsyncProvider<T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of input data.
    S - the type of output data.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SequentialProvider, ThreadPoolProvider, TimerProvider

    public abstract class AsyncProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
extends AndroidProvider<T,S>
    Abstract implementation of a Provider based on AsyncTask. Whenever execute(long, Data[]) is called, a new task is submitted to the Executor backing the AsyncTask.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher
      Interface used for passing the progress updates from the AsyncProvider context to the AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask one and finally calling Provider.publishProgresses(long, ProgressData...).
      private class  AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask
      AsyncTask implementation using the callbacks defined in the upper class.

    • Field Summary

      The Executor backing the AsyncTask instances.
      private int pendingTasks 
      private static java.lang.String TAG

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public abstract S[] getData(AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher progressPublisher,
                            long requestID,
                            T... input)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides the data given some input data. It will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[])
        Parameters:
        progressPublisher - interface for publishing progress through Provider.publishProgress(long, int, String) by using AsyncTask.publishProgress(Object[]) and AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onProgressUpdate(ProgressData[]).
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        input - the input data.
        Returns:
        the output data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception thrown will be caught in and passed to onPostExecuteError(long, Throwable).
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[]), execute(long, Data[])

      • onPreExecute

        public void onPreExecute(long requestID)
        Callback that will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPreExecute().
        Parameters:
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPreExecute()

      • onPostExecuteResult

        public void onPostExecuteResult(long requestID,
                                S... output)
        Callback that will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPostExecute(Data[]) in case no error occurred, after having stored the output in the Provider.outStore.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        output - the output produced by getData(ProgressPublisher, long, Data[])
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPostExecute(Data[]), onPostExecuteError(long, Throwable), Provider.publishResults(long, Data[])

      • onPostExecuteError

        public void onPostExecuteError(long requestID,
                               java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Callback that will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPostExecute(Data[]) in case an error occurred, after having published an error progress with progress=-1.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        throwable - the throwable that caused the error.
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onPostExecute(Data[]), onPostExecuteResult(long, Data[]), Provider.publishProgresses(long, ProgressData...)

      • onProgressUpdate

        public void onProgressUpdate(long requestID,
                             ProgressData... values)
        Callback that will be called in {@link ProviderAsyncTask#onProgressUpdate(ProgressData...), after having published the progresses.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        values - the progress updates that have been published
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onProgressUpdate(ProgressData...), Provider.publishProgresses(long, ProgressData...)

      • setExecutor

        protected void setExecutor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Parameters:
        executor - the Executor that will be used for upcoming tasks.

      • execute

        public void execute(long requestID,
                    T... input)
        Schedules a new task in the executor.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Provider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
        Parameters:

        input - the input data.
        See Also:

      • getPendingTasks

        public int getPendingTasks()
        Returns the number of tasks that have been submitted but have not completed yet.
